jparsec.time

Class SiderealTime

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.time.SiderealTime

  • public class SiderealTime
extends java.lang.Object
    Calculate mean or apparent sidereal time through different methods. Depending on the ephemeris properties the methods in this class will use algorithms according to different methods or IAU resolutions: IAU 1976, 2000/2006/2009 (the three treated in the same way), WILLIAMS/SIMON 1994 (both treated in the same way), and DE403 method.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Method Detail

      • greenwichMeanSiderealTime

        public static double greenwichMeanSiderealTime(TimeElement time,
                               ObserverElement obs,
                               EphemerisElement eph)
                                        throws JPARSECException
        Calculates the Greenwich mean sidereal time.

        This function returns mean Greenwich sidereal time for the given Julian day in UT1.

        References:

        SOFA subroutine GMST2000.f.

        Capitaine et al., Astronomy & Astrophysics 412, 567-586, EQ. (42).

        James G. Williams, "Contributions to the Earth's obliquity rate, precession, and nutation," Astron. J. 108, 711-724 (1994).

        J. H. Lieske, T. Lederle, W. Fricke, and B. Morando, "Expressions for the Precession Quantities Based upon the IAU (1976) System of Astronomical Constants," Astronomy and Astrophysics 58, 1-16 (1977).

        Parameters:
        time - Time object containing the date.
        obs - Observer object containing the observer position.
        eph - Ephemeris object.
        Returns:
        Greenwich mean sidereal time in radians.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the date is invalid.

      • equationOfTime

        public static double equationOfTime(TimeElement time,
                    ObserverElement obs,
                    EphemerisElement eph)
                             throws JPARSECException
        Returns the equation of time for a given instant.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        obs - Observer object.
        eph - Ephemeris object. If defined, the algorithm, set of reduction algorithms, and the geocentric/topocentric flag are taken from it. Default values are Moshier, IAU 2006, and geocentric.
        Returns:
        Equation of time in radians.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • equationOfEquinoxes

        public static double equationOfEquinoxes(TimeElement time,
                         ObserverElement obs,
                         EphemerisElement eph)
                                  throws JPARSECException
        Returns equation of equinoxes. Complementary terms are included in case of IAU 2000/2006/2009 reduction methods.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        obs - Observer object.
        eph - Ephemeris object.
        Returns:
        Equation of Equinoxes in radians.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the date is invalid.
